description: Borrowed from Latin mediālis (“middle”), from medius (“that is in the middle or midst”) +‎ -ālis (“-al”, adjectival suffix).

adjectives.description: medial (comparative more medial, superlative most medial)

entries.meaning: (mathematics) Of or pertaining to a mean or average.

definitionGroups.group: Situated in or near the middle; not at either end.

entries.meaning: (anatomy, zootomy) Pertaining to the inside; closer to the median plane of the body or the midline of an organ.
examples: The medial side of the knee faces the other knee, while the outer side of the knee is lateral.

entries.meaning: (anatomy) Pertaining to the middle layer of a blood vessel, to its tunica media.
(entomology) Of or pertaining to the media and/or the areas of the wing next to it.
(phonetics) (of a speech sound) In the middle of a word.
(phonetics) (of a consonant) Central: produced when air flows across the center of the mouth over the tongue.

definitionGroups.group: Any of various things that occur in the middle.

entries.meaning: One or more letters that occur in the middle of a word.
